section.title: Addons
section.para: The addons resource will automatically attempt to load any modules or extensions under the specified path(s) using the addons manager .
Here's how to specify an addons path in a configuration file:resources.addons.paths[YourNamespace] = APPLICATION_PATH "/addons"
Anything specified in the brackets will be used as the namespace under wich the addons path is. The default namespace is MajistiX.

example.title: Loading a module
example.para: In order to load a module into your application, simply use the following syntax in your configuration file:resources.addons.module[Namespace] = "yourModuleName" resources.addons.module[] = "yourSecondModuleName" //uses MajistiX namespace by default
The first line would load a module operating under your given namespace, while the second one loads the second module using Majisti's default modules and extensions namespace, MajistiX.

example.title: Loading an extension
example.para: In order to load an extension into your application, simply use the following syntax in your configuration file:resources.addons.extension[Namespace] = "yourExtensionName" resources.addons.extension[] = "yourSecondExtensionName" //uses MajistiX namespace by default
The first line would load an extension operating under your given namespace, while the second one loads the second extension using Majisti's default modules and extensions namespace, MajistiX.
